company: PT PLN Indonesia Power UBP Semarang
description: A motivated Electrical Engineering diploma student from Politeknik Negeri Semarang, currently seeking internship opportunities to apply practical knowledge in embedded systems, electronics, and control engineering. Experienced in participating in academic projects and student organization events.

As a Lecturer in Computer Engineering, I am involved in the end-to-end pedagogy process, including updating lesson plans based on Outcome-Based Education (OBE) and current issues, developing interactive and easy-to-understand lecture materials, and assessing student outcomes. I am actively engaged in research and community outreach, with several publications and intellectual property to my name. Appointed as the Research Coordinator in the Faculty of Engineering and Informatics under the Dean, I organize regular meetings (FTI Research Talk), coaching clinics for publication and grant writing, manage UMN journals, and collaborate with external parties to promote research. Additionally, I actively contribute to the promotion and marketing of UMN to prospective students, participate in curriculum development, and handle administrative tasks related to accreditation and quality improvement. I have also successfully led several projects funded by both internal and external sources.
Control the quality of electronic part production for various printer models, analyze product defects, and provide recommendations to address issues or identify potential root causes.

I have built an embedded system for water sampling and designed and implemented a wireless sensor network for monitoring shrimp fields. Additionally, I authored an academic paper for international publication titled [A wireless sensor network platform for shrimp farm monitoring](https://ieee.org/abstract/document/7237850), which has received 40 citations.
